title: Valentine prompt single-page UI with evasive No and Yes meme reveal

requirements.summary: Build a single-page Valentine prompt UI with a pink/white romantic theme and exactly two prominent options (Yes/No) sized and laid out for iPad Chrome.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing view shows the question “Will you be my Valentine?” with two buttons labeled “Yes” and “No”.
Overall styling is clearly romantic and uses a pink/white palette (background, typography, accents).
Layout is responsive and usable on iPad Chrome in both portrait and landscape.

file_operations.description: Implement a single-screen React view rendering the question and exactly two prominent buttons (“Yes”, “No”) using Tailwind for a pink/white romantic layout optimized for iPad Chrome (portrait/landscape).
Add Tailwind directives and global romantic pink/white theming (background, typography defaults, spacing) using existing styling entry point conventions.

requirements.summary: Make the “No” button evade pointer interactions by relocating within the visible area on hover/pointer enter, staying clear of the Yes button and question text.
acceptanceCriteria: On pointer hover/enter over the “No” button, it immediately relocates to a different position within the visible area.
The “No” button remains within the viewport and does not overlap the “Yes” button or the main question text.

file_operations.description: Add pointer-device evasive behavior for the “No” button (e.g., onPointerEnter), computing a new random position within a bounded container while avoiding overlap with the question and “Yes” button (use refs/measurements as needed).

requirements.summary: Add touch-friendly evasive behavior so tapping “No” on iPad/touch devices makes it move away before a click completes.
acceptanceCriteria: On touchstart/tap attempt on “No”, the button relocates before it can be successfully clicked.
The experience remains smooth and does not require a keyboard or mouse to function.

file_operations.description: Add touch evasive handling for the “No” button (e.g., onTouchStart and/or pointer events) to relocate immediately and prevent a completed click on touch devices like iPad.

requirements.summary: On “Yes” click, switch to a celebratory state showing the meme image and the exact text “Good choice”, removing/ignoring the original buttons.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” transitions to a new state that shows the meme image and the exact text “Good choice”.
After “Yes” is clicked, the “Yes/No” buttons are no longer shown or are clearly disabled/irrelevant.

file_operations.description: Implement UI state transition on “Yes” click to replace the prompt with a celebratory view that renders the static image and displays the exact text “Good choice”, and hides/disables the original “Yes/No” controls.

requirements.summary: Add the required generated image asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it as a static frontend asset (no backend fetch).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated image file(s) exist in frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified in the image requirements.
Frontend displays the image via a static path (e.g., /assets/generated/...).

file_operations.description: Add the generated meme-style romantic image asset with bold readable text “Good choice”, pink/white palette, heart accents.
Render the generated image from the celebratory view using the exact static asset path referencing frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1024x1024.png.
